level.heading: Disposition of fees.
level.text: Effective June 14, 1980, all fees and receipts from those activities for which the Department of Recreation and Parks determines to charge a fee shall be deposited in the General Fund.

level.heading: History
level.text: (Apr. 29, 1942, ch. 265, art. II, ยง 4a, as added May 16, 1995, D.C. Law 10-255, ยง 12, 41 DCR 5193.)

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-255
level.text: Law 10-255, the "Technical Amendments Act of 1994," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-673, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 21, 1994, and July 5, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 1995, it was assigned Act No. 10-302 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-255 became effective May 16, 1995.

level.heading: References in Text
level.text: Pursuant to Mayor's Order 2000-20, the agency formerly known as the Department of Recreation and Parks shall be known as the Department of Parks and Recreation.
